sen.j: 八尺瓊勾玉（やさかにのまがたま）は八咫鏡・天叢雲剣と共に三種の神器の一つ。
sen.e: Yasakani no magatama is one of the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family, along with Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror) and Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (the sword Ame-no-Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds").

The Yasakani no magatama is one of the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family, along with the Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror) and the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (the sword Ame-no-Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds").
sen.cmt: added "the" before "Yasakani" "Yata" and "Ame";
sen.e: The Yasakani no magatama is one of the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family, along with the Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror) and the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (the sword Ame-no-Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds").
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: I is written in another kanji characters '八坂瓊曲玉'.
Usually written as '八尺瓊勾玉', it is also written with the characters '八坂瓊曲玉'.
sen.cmt: added characters of the first reading so that comparison can be made with the second reading; added "also"; changed "another" to "with"; added "the";
sen.e: Usually written as '八尺瓊勾玉,' it is also written with the characters '八坂瓊曲玉.'
sen.cmt: カンマ、ピリオド位置移動

sen.j: 大きな勾玉とも、長い緒に繋いだ勾玉ともされる。
sen.e: It has been handed down as a large magadama (a comma-shaped bead) or a magadama strung with a long strap.
It has been handed down as a large magatama (a comma-shaped bead) or a magatama connected to a long strap.
sen.cmt: changed "strung with a" to "connected to a"; magadama→magatama;
sen.e: It has been handed down as a large magatama (a comma-shaped bead) or a magatama connected to a long strap.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「さか」は尺の字が宛てられている。
sen.e: The kanji character '尺' (shaku) is used to express the kana characters 'saka' of the term, Yasakani.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The kanji character '尺' (shaku) is used to express the phonetic sound of 'saka' in 'Yasakani.'
sen.cmt: changed "kana characters" to "phonetic sound of";
sen.e: The kanji character '尺' (shaku) is used to express the phonetic sound of 'saka' in 'Yasakani.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、本来は上代の長さの単位の咫（あた）のことである。
sen.e: However, 'saka' originally means '咫' (ata), which stands for a unit of length in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The original meaning of 'saka,' however, means '咫' (ata) which stands for a unit of length used in ancient times.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The original meaning of 'saka,' however, means '咫' (ata) which stands for a unit of length used in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただし、ここでいう「八尺」（八咫）は文字通りの8咫（約1.4メートル）ではなく、通常よりも大きいまたは長いという意味である。
sen.e: Nevertheless, the term 'eight saka' here does not literally mean actual eight ata (approx. 1.4 meters) but simply means extraordinary large or long.

In this regard, with the character '八' meaning 'eight' and being used to represent the 'ya' of 'Yasakani,' the portion of the word read as 'Yasaka' appears to mean 'eight saka' or 'eight aka' (which would be about 1.4 meters), but the actual meaning is simply extraordinarily large or long.
sen.cmt: added description for 'ya' '八' to assist the meaning for English readers;
sen.e: In this regard, with the character '八' meaning 'eight' and being used to represent the 'ya' of 'Yasakani,' the portion of the word read as 'Yasaka' appears to mean 'eight saka' or 'eight aka' (which would be about 1.4 meters), but the actual meaning is simply extraordinarily large or long.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、「弥栄」（いやさか）が転じたものとする説もある。
sen.e: In addition, there is another theory that the origin of the term is 'Iyasaka' (happiness and prosperity).
There is another theory that the origin of the term is 'iyasaka,' meaning happiness and prosperity.
sen.cmt: moved (happiness and prosperity) out of parenthesis and into the sentence; made 'iyasaka' lowercase
sen.e: There is another theory that the origin of the term is 'iyasaka,' meaning happiness and prosperity.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「瓊」は赤色の玉のことである。
sen.e: The term 'ni' of Yasakani means red orb.
The character used to represent the sound of 'ni' of Yasakani is '瓊' which means 'red orb.'
sen.cmt: added kanji character and fixed to be easier to understand;
sen.e: The character used to represent the sound of 'ni' of Yasakani is '瓊' which means 'red orb.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: It is sometimes called 'ji' (a sacred jewel).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The jewel is sometimes referred to as 'ji' (a sacred jewel).
sen.cmt: changed "It" to "The jewel"; fixed grammar
sen.e: The jewel is sometimes referred to as 'ji' (a sacred jewel).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: やはり三種の神器のひとつである剣とあわせて「剣璽」と称される。
sen.e: When it is combined with the sword which is also one of the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family, they are referred to as 'Kenji', which means the Sacred Sword and the Sacred Jewel.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the jewel is combined with the sword, together they are referred to as 'Kenji,' meaning the Sacred Sword and the Sacred Jewel.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: When the jewel is combined with the sword, together they are referred to as 'Kenji,' meaning the Sacred Sword and the Sacred Jewel.

sen.j: その存在について、「日(陽)」を表す八咫鏡に対して「月(陰)」を表しているのではないかという説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that it may symbolizes 'the moon' (yin or negative) in contrast to Yata no Kagami, which symbolizes 'the sun' (yang or positive).
There is a theory that the jewel symbolizes the moon (yin or negative) in contrast to the Yata no Kagami, which symbolizes the sun (yang or positive).

sen.e: There is a theory that the jewel symbolizes the moon (yin or negative) in contrast to the Yata no Kagami, which symbolizes the sun (yang or positive).

sen.j: 日本神話では、岩戸隠れの際に後に玉造連の祖神となるタマノオヤが作った。
sen.e: According to the Japanese Mythology, it was made by Tamanooya, who was the deity from which Tamasuri no muraji was descended.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to Japanese mythology, the jewel was made by Tamanooya, who was the deity from which Tamasuri no muraji descended.
sen.cmt: eliminated "the" before "Japanese"; made "mythology" lowercase; eliminated "was" before "descended";
sen.e: According to Japanese mythology, the jewel was made by Tamanooya when Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave) happened, who was the deity from which Tamasuri no muraji descended.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ補足しました。

sen.j: そして、八咫鏡とともにフトダマが捧げ持つサカキの木に掛けられた。
sen.e: After that, along with Yata no Kagami, it was hung from sakaki (sacred tree of shinto) which was held by Futodama in both hands raised just above eye level.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Along with the Yata no Kagami, the jewel was hung on a sakaki (species of evergreen sacred to Shinto), held reverently in both hands by the god Futodama.

sen.e: Along with the Yata no Kagami, the jewel was hung on a sakaki (species of evergreen sacred to Shinto), held reverently in both hands by the god Futodama.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後に天孫降臨に際してニニギに授けられたとする。
sen.e: It is said to have been dedicated to Ninigi at the time of tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess).
Later on, it is said that the jewel was given to Ninigi (the grandson of the Sun Goddess) during the 'Tensonkorin' where he descended to earth in order to rule the country.

sen.e: Later on, it is said that the jewel was given to Ninigi (the grandson of the Sun Goddess) during the 'Tensonkorin' where he descended to earth in order to rule the country.

sen.j: 現在は、御所の中の、天皇の寝室の横に剣璽の間があり、そこに剣とともに安置されているとされる。
sen.e: As present, it is said to be enshrined together with the sword in Kenji no Ma (hall of sacred sword and jewels), which is situated beside the bedroom of the emperor in gosho (Imperial Palace).

At present, the Yasakani no magatama is said to be enshrined together with the sword in the Kenji no Ma (hall of sacred sword and jewel), situated beside the bedroom of the emperor in the Gosho (Imperial Palace).
